alert_details.alert_reason: Circular money movement between 5 related entities, ₹45 lakhs circulating with no apparent business purpose, minimal value addition

incoming_transactions.pattern_notes: Funds received from same 4 entities repeatedly, all companies incorporated within 6 months of each other

outgoing_transactions.pattern_notes: Outgoing transfers to same entities that sent incoming funds, creating circular pattern

network_analysis.entity_2: Global Tech Solutions Ltd - Director: Vikram Shah (same as Vijay Ent.)
network_analysis.entity_3: Metro Trading Co - Director: Anjali Rao (same as Vijay Ent.)
network_analysis.entity_4: Sunrise Exports Pvt Ltd - Director: Pradeep Shah (brother of Vikram Shah)
network_analysis.entity_5: Peak Ventures India - Director: Rajesh Rao (brother of Anjali Rao)
network_analysis.relationship: All 5 entities controlled by same family group, same registered address

business_verification.physical_presence: Minimal - shared office space, no employees visible
business_verification.trade_activity: No evidence of actual goods/services exchange
business_verification.invoices_checked: Generic invoices with vague descriptions, no shipping documents
business_verification.gst_returns: Filed but revenue reported inconsistent with transaction volume

red_flags: Same family members control all 5 entities
₹45 lakhs circulating with minimal economic value creation
No evidence of actual business activity or goods/services exchange
Shared office address across all entities
Pattern consistent with layering phase of money laundering
Appears designed to create illusion of legitimate business
Rapid back-and-forth transfers between related parties
Net position change minimal despite high transaction volume
additional_context.actual_evidence: No customs documentation, no shipping records, no inventory

typology_mapping.fincen_reference: Complex Layering Schemes Using Multiple Entities
typology_mapping.description: Use of interconnected shell companies to move funds in circular patterns, creating appearance of legitimate business activity while obscuring the true source and ownership of funds

internal_checks.adverse_media: No media coverage found for any entity
internal_checks.previous_sars: No prior SARs on this entity

external_verification.corporate_registry: All 5 companies incorporated 2024-2025, minimal paid-up capital
external_verification.physical_verification: Shared virtual office, no operational presence
external_verification.trade_verification: No customs records, no import/export documentation
external_verification.director_background: Directors share family relationship, multiple companies each

investigative_findings.analyst_conclusion: The interconnected network of related entities engaging in circular fund transfers with no demonstrable business purpose represents a sophisticated layering operation. The lack of legitimate business activity, combined with family control and shared infrastructure, indicates funds are being moved to obscure their origin. Recommends SAR filing and potential referral for deeper investigation.
